Puzzle.Question: I have keys but no locks, space but no room, and you can enter but not go inside. What am I?
What has to be broken before you can use it?
I speak without a mouth and hear without ears. I have no body, but I come alive with sound. What am I?
What has hands but cannot clap?
What gets wetter the more it dries?
I’m tall when I’m young, and I’m short when I’m old. What am I?
What can you catch but not throw?
What has a face and two hands but no arms or legs?
What has many teeth but cannot bite?
What can travel around the world while staying in the same corner?
What has a neck but no head?
What has one eye but cannot see?
Which month of the year has 28 days?
What begins with T, ends with T, and has T in it?
What belongs to you but is used more often by others?
What goes up but never comes down?
What has four wheels and flies?
What can you hold in your left hand but never in your right hand?
What kind of room has no doors or windows?
What has a head and a tail but no body?
The more of this there is, the less you see. What is it?
What runs but never walks, has a bed but never sleeps?
What has words but never speaks?
What is full of holes but still holds water?
What goes up and down but does not move?
What has ears but cannot hear?
What can you keep after giving it to someone?
What has an end but no beginning, a home but no family, and a space without room? (Programming)
In many programming languages, what keyword is used to define a function?
In binary, what number comes after 1?
If you multiply any number by zero, what do you get?
I’m not alive, but if you feed me, I grow. If you give me water, I die. What am I?
What has cities, but no houses; forests, but no trees; and rivers, but no water?
What gets bigger the more you take away from it?
Which weighs more, a kilo of feathers or a kilo of steel?
What number do you get if you divide any number by itself (except zero)?
What has rings but no fingers?
If you write code that repeats forever and never stops, what kind of loop is that?
In many languages, what symbol is commonly used to mark a single-line comment?
If 3 + x = 5, what is x?
What comes once in a minute, twice in a moment, but never in a thousand years?
What can fill a room but takes up no space?
What has a thumb and four fingers, but is not alive?
What building has the most stories?
What kind of key can’t open locks?
You see me once in June, twice in November, but not at all in May. What am I?
If today is Monday, what day will it be in two days?
What has stripes and goes down but never goes up, appearing on roads to slow cars?
I’m always in front of you but can’t be seen. What am I?
What 3-letter word becomes shorter when you add two letters to it?
I’m taken from a mine and shut up in a wooden case, from which I’m never released, yet I’m used by almost every student. What am I?
I have branches but no fruit, trunk, or leaves. What am I?
What flies forever, rests never, and can kill time but not people?
I can be written, compiled, and run, but I am not a race. What am I?
I have no windows or doors, but you still debug inside me. In programming, what am I?
What disappears as soon as you say its name?
What has keys that open no locks and space but no room, yet helps you talk to machines?
You throw away the outside and cook the inside. Then you eat the outside and throw away the inside. What did you eat?
I can store many values, all in a row. In programming, I’m indexed but never stressed. What am I?
What 3-digit number is equal to 3 × 3 × 3 × 3?
A variable starts at 10. You subtract 3, then add 5, then subtract 4. What is its final value?
I have an eye but cannot see, and when I open, water runs free. What am I?
I hide in code and change what happens only when a condition is true. What am I?
I am bought by the meter but worn by the foot. What am I?
If you double me and add 10, you get 30. What number am I?
What increases but never decreases, can be logged but not touched, and tells you how long something has been running?
Which is larger: the sum 1 + 2 + 3 + 4 or 2 × 5?
I’m where your code goes to rest, yet I’m not a bed. I keep old versions of files. What am I?
I start with an E, end with an E, but usually contain just one letter. What am I?
The more you take, the more you leave behind. What are they?
If x = 4 and y = 3, what is x² + y²?
What do programmers call a mistake in the code that causes unexpected behavior?
What has a heart that doesn’t beat and rings that don’t sing, but helps measure time?
Puzzle.CorrectAnswer: Tree trunk (rings) in a calendar year

Puzzle.Question: If a number is divisible by 2 and by 3, which of these is it also divisible by?
I mark the start and end of strings in many languages, yet I’m just a symbol. What am I?
You see me in years, you see me in days, but never in hours or minutes. What am I?
If a loop runs 5 times, adding 2 to a starting value of 0 each time, what is the final value?
I turn coffee into code but I’m not a machine. What am I?
I am always in front of you but can never be seen, measured in seconds but not in meters. What am I?
If 2^3 = 8, what is 2^4?
I connect two values with a condition. In many languages, I can be >, <, or ==. What am I?
What two-digit number is equal to 7 × 7?
I can run, but I never walk; I have a bed, but never sleep. I’m used in testing but not in dreams. What am I?
Which number is halfway between 10 and 20?
In many languages, what is the name for a function that calls itself?
What has a head, a tail, is brown, and has no legs?
If you reverse me I’m still the same. I’m a number greater than 9 but less than 12. What am I?
I group related data together in many languages and can hold different types. What am I?
If 5x = 45, what is x?
What do you call a name given to a storage location in programming?
I am always hungry and will die if you give me water. What am I?
I keep things in order by index, but I’m not a librarian. What am I?
If the sum of three consecutive numbers is 18, what is the middle number?
I’m a loop that never ends unless you break me. What kind of loop am I?
If 100 in binary is 4 in decimal, what decimal number is 101 in binary?
What has many lines of text, can be compiled or interpreted, and often starts with an import?
What 2-digit number is the same as the sum of its digits multiplied by 4? (Example: 12, (1+2)×4 = 12)
I’m used in loops, count from 0 or 1, and often named i. What am I?
I am not a bug, but I fix bugs. I step through code line by line. What am I?
If 9 + x = 3 × 7, what is x?
I am an odd number. Take away one letter and I become even. What number am I?
Two fathers and two sons sit down to code. They each write one program, but only three programs are written. How is that possible?
Puzzle.CorrectAnswer: They are grandfather, father, and son

Puzzle.Question: What 3-digit number has a hundreds digit 3, a tens digit 4, and is divisible by 9?
In a language that starts array indices at 0, what is the index of the last element in an array of length n?
If x is an even integer and y is an odd integer, which of these must always be odd?
You see a variable in code that never changes after it is set once. It is used for configuration and shared across functions. What is it most likely?
There are 8 bits in a byte. How many distinct values can a single byte represent?
I start with 1, end with 1, and in between I am filled with zeros and ones. In computing, what am I?
You have a function that calls itself directly or indirectly. If you forget the base case, what is the result?
In a sorted list of 1024 elements, which search method is more efficient: linear search or binary search, and why?
Puzzle.CorrectAnswer: Binary search, because it runs in O(log n)
Puzzle.WrongAnswer: Linear search, because it checks every element
It depends on the data type

Puzzle.Question: You have three consecutive integers whose sum is 30. What is the middle integer?
In many languages, what does "==" mean when used between two variables?
I am always in front of you, never behind you, but every time you move, I move too. I can be estimated, but never seen. What am I?
A number is divisible by 9 if the sum of its digits is divisible by 9. Is 4374 divisible by 9?
In a 24-hour clock, how many right angles do the hour and minute hands form in one full day?
In Big-O notation, which growth is faster as n becomes very large: O(n²) or O(n log n)?
What 3-digit number is equal to 7 × 11 × 13?
A list has the elements [2, 4, 6, 8]. You map each element x to x × x. What is the resulting list?
What do we call a situation where two or more threads are blocked forever, each waiting for the other to release a resource?
In binary, 1010 represents 10 in decimal. What decimal number does 1101 represent?
I am always hungry, I eat bits, and I shift things left and right. In programming and hardware, what am I?
You roll two fair six-sided dice. What is the probability that the sum is 7?
What number do you get if you add all the numbers from 1 to 100 inclusive?
You see the code: if (a > b && b > c) { ... }. Which of these must be true if the condition is true?
Puzzle.CorrectAnswer: a is greater than both b and c

Puzzle.Question: Which data structure follows the Last-In, First-Out (LIFO) principle?
Which data structure follows the First-In, First-Out (FIFO) principle?
I move only forward, not backward. I point to the next, but never to the past. In programming, what structure am I?
There are 30 students in a class. Each student shakes hands with every other student exactly once. How many handshakes occur?
A password consists of 3 lowercase letters, each can be from a to z. How many possible passwords are there, ignoring dictionary words?
In many languages, what does the operator "!" represent when applied to a boolean expression?
I start full, then get empty, yet I hold code instead of water. I help you undo mistakes. What am I?
What is the smallest positive integer that is divisible by 2, 3, and 5?
You enter a room and see a computer, a router, and a switch. Only one of them is off. The lights are off, but the fans are spinning. Which one is most likely off?
A function f(n) runs in O(2^n) time. A function g(n) runs in O(n^3) time. For very large n, which is asymptotically faster?
You have a sorted array and want to frequently insert new elements in the middle. Which structure is generally more efficient for many insertions?
I am a path that visits every vertex exactly once in a graph. What am I called?
I am a path that uses every edge exactly once in a graph. What am I called?
Which of these search algorithms guarantees the shortest path in an unweighted graph?
In many languages, what keyword is used to create a new instance of a class?
You have a 10-element array. How many valid indices are there in a 0-based indexing system?
If 3^x = 81, what is x?
In a hash table with a good hash function and low load factor, what is the average-case complexity of lookup?
In many languages, what is the typical result of dividing an integer by zero at runtime?
I compress information but may lose some details. In computing, what kind of compression am I?
I compress information without losing any data. In computing, what kind of compression am I?
What is the derivative of x² with respect to x?
What is the integral of 2x with respect to x (ignoring the constant of integration)?
If a function has time complexity O(n³), and you double the input size, by what factor does the runtime grow approximately?
You sort a list of n items using an algorithm with average complexity O(n log n). If you double n, the time grows by approximately what factor?
In many languages, what keyword is used to handle an error or exception that might occur in a block of code?
I am a 2-digit prime number. If you reverse my digits, you get a different prime. Their sum is 88. What number am I?
You have a sorted array of 1,024 distinct numbers. In the worst case of binary search, how many comparisons do you need at most (approximate to the nearest whole number)?
I am the smallest positive integer that leaves remainder 1 when divided by 2, 3, and 4. What number am I?
In a programming language with 32-bit signed integers, what is the usual maximum value representable (in decimal)?
In many languages, what is the time complexity of inserting an element at the front of a singly linked list when you already have the head pointer?
If 2^a = 32 and 2^b = 8, what is 2^(a + b)?
In an undirected simple graph, what is the maximum number of edges in a graph with 10 vertices?
I am the complexity of the naive recursive Fibonacci implementation. What Big-O time complexity best describes me?
You push 3 values onto a stack in this order: 10, then 20, then 30. You pop once and then peek. What value do you see?
A number is divisible by 11 if the alternating sum of its digits is divisible by 11. Is 50677 divisible by 11?
You have a 3-level nested loop; each loop runs from 1 to n. Ignoring the body, how many total iterations run?
I am a path in a graph that starts and ends at the same vertex and uses every edge exactly once. What am I?
If f(n) = 3n^2 + 10n + 7, which Big-O notation best describes its asymptotic growth?
I am a 2-digit number. When you square me, the result ends with the same two digits. What number am I?
In many languages, what is the typical worst-case time complexity of quicksort on an already sorted array if you always choose the first element as pivot?
A function calls itself twice for each call, and stops at depth k. Roughly how many calls are made?
You are given an array of length n and you perform a merge sort. How many levels of merging (approximately) will there be?
In a balanced binary search tree with n nodes, what is the worst-case time complexity for inserting a new key?
I am a 3-digit number. The sum of my digits is 15, and all my digits are odd. I am divisible by 5 and greater than 500. What number am I?
You perform a binary search on a sorted list that may contain duplicates. What can you guarantee about the position returned for a value?
Puzzle.CorrectAnswer: It is some valid index where the value appears
Puzzle.WrongAnswer: It is always the first occurrence
It is always the last occurrence
It is always the median element

Puzzle.Question: You have n distinct objects and want to arrange them in a line. How many permutations are there?
An algorithm runs in time T(n) = T(n/2) + O(1). Which Big-O describes T(n)?
You have 5 distinct books and 2 shelves. Each book must go on exactly one shelf. How many different distributions are possible (order on a shelf does not matter)?
In many languages, what is the name of a function that is defined inside another function and can access its variables?
If the time complexity of an algorithm is O(n!) and n increases from 5 to 6, by what factor does the dominant term increase?
You hash 1,000 keys into 10,000 buckets with a good uniform hash. What is the expected average number of keys per bucket?
I am a real number that is equal to my own square. Which of these could I be?
In a directed acyclic graph (DAG), what traversal or ordering lists vertices so that every edge goes from an earlier vertex to a later one?
A palindrome is a string that reads the same forwards and backwards. Which of these is a binary palindrome?
In many languages, what is the usual size (in bits) of a standard IPv4 address?
You roll two fair six-sided dice. What is the probability that the product of the two numbers is even?
An array has 256 elements. You use binary search to find a value. What is the maximum number of comparisons needed in the worst case?
You have a full binary tree of height h (root at height 0). How many leaves does it have?
In many languages, what is the default time complexity to access an element by index in a dynamic array (like std::vector or ArrayList)?
You have 10 bits. How many different distinct bit patterns can you represent?
Which of these can cause a race condition in concurrent programming?
Puzzle.CorrectAnswer: Two threads writing to the same variable without synchronization
Puzzle.WrongAnswer: Two threads using only read-only data

Puzzle.Question: In many languages, which type of error is detected at compile time, before the program runs?
I am the smallest positive integer that is divisible by 1, 2, 3, and 4. What number am I?
You measure algorithmic complexity using Big-O notation. What does it ignore?
You want to ensure that a function can accept any type but still be type-checked at compile time. Which language feature is typically used?
You have three flags: debug, verbose, and trace. You pack them into bits of a single byte. How many different combinations of these three flags are possible?
A 4-digit PIN code uses digits 0–9 and digits may repeat. How many possible PINs are there?
In many languages, which logical operator short-circuits and will not evaluate the second operand if the first operand is false?
In floating-point arithmetic, which of these values cannot be represented exactly in binary IEEE 754 single precision?
You have a 3x3 grid and want to place 3 indistinguishable tokens in different cells. How many ways can you choose the cells?
In many languages, what is the effect of using the modulo operator x % n when x is a non-negative integer?
Puzzle.CorrectAnswer: Gives the remainder of dividing x by n
Puzzle.WrongAnswer: Gives the quotient of x divided by n
Rounds x to the nearest multiple of n
Always returns a value between -n and n

Puzzle.Question: I am a special kind of function that does not change the data I transform: f(f(x)) = x for all x in my domain. What am I?
You have 6 distinct vertices and want to form a simple cycle that uses all of them exactly once and returns to the start. How many vertices are in this cycle?
In many languages, what feature allows you to write a function that takes another function as an argument?
An algorithm runs in O(log n) time. You increase the input size from 1,000 to 1,000,000. Which of these best describes the change in running time?
Puzzle.CorrectAnswer: It increases by a constant factor, about log(1,000,000) / log(1,000)

Puzzle.Question: I am the smallest positive integer that is divisible by 7, 8, and 9. What number am I?
You have a function with time complexity T(n) = 2T(n/2) + n. Which Big-O best describes T(n)?
You toss a fair coin 4 times. What is the probability of getting exactly 2 heads?
In complexity theory, which of these problems is known to be NP-complete (under standard assumptions)?
You have a graph with n vertices and every pair of distinct vertices is connected by an edge. What is this graph called?
In a complete graph with 6 vertices, how many distinct simple cycles of length 3 (triangles) exist?
A 64-bit unsigned integer type can represent how many distinct values?
You have a dynamic array that doubles its capacity when full. Amortized over many insertions at the end, what is the average time per insertion?
Which of these is a necessary condition for a connected undirected graph to have an Eulerian circuit?
Puzzle.WrongAnswer: Graph has at least one cycle

Puzzle.Question: You are given two relatively prime integers a and b. What is the greatest common divisor gcd(a, b)?
In many languages, a hash map (dictionary) with a good hash function typically has what average-case complexity for insert and lookup?
You multiply two n × n matrices using the naive algorithm. How many scalar multiplications are required (in terms of n)?
Which of these sequences is defined by the recurrence F(n) = F(n-1) + F(n-2), with F(0) = 0 and F(1) = 1?
You need a data structure that supports extracting the minimum element quickly and also supports insert in O(log n). Which should you choose?
Which Big-O notation describes the worst-case time complexity of depth-first search on a graph with V vertices and E edges?
Which of these sorting algorithms is guaranteed to be stable in its standard form?
You have 10 distinct items and want to choose 3 of them without order and without repetition. How many choices are there?
If p is a prime number greater than 2, which of these statements is always true?
In modular arithmetic, what is 7 × 8 (mod 5)?
In many languages, what is a closure?
Puzzle.CorrectAnswer: A function plus its captured environment
Puzzle.WrongAnswer: A function that closes a file
A function that exits the program

Puzzle.Question: You run Dijkstra's algorithm on a graph with V vertices and E edges using a binary heap. What is the typical time complexity?
Which of these numbers is both a square and a cube of integers?
You have an infinite geometric series with first term 1 and common ratio 1/2. What is its sum?
In many statically typed languages, what does type inference do?
Puzzle.CorrectAnswer: Automatically deduces variable types from usage

Puzzle.Question: A 128-bit key is used in a symmetric cipher. Roughly how many possible keys are there?
Which of these is an invariant in a correct binary search tree implementation?
Puzzle.CorrectAnswer: Left subtree keys < node key < right subtree keys
Puzzle.WrongAnswer: All keys equal in left and right subtrees
Every node has exactly two children
All leaves are at the same depth

Puzzle.Question: You have N people in a room, each shaking hands with every other person exactly once. How many handshakes occur?
In many languages, what is tail recursion optimization (TCO) intended to do?
Puzzle.CorrectAnswer: Reuse the current stack frame for tail calls

Puzzle.Question: Which of these logical formulas is a tautology (true for all boolean values of A)?
In modular arithmetic, what is the multiplicative inverse of 3 modulo 11?
You have a 5-character password using only lowercase letters a–z. How many possible passwords exist?
Which of these is a necessary condition for a matrix to be invertible over the reals?
In a red-black tree, which of these properties must always hold?
Puzzle.CorrectAnswer: No red node has a red child

Puzzle.Question: Which of these is the correct formula for the sum of the first n positive integers?
In many languages, what does it mean for a type system to be sound?
Puzzle.CorrectAnswer: Well-typed programs do not go wrong (no invalid operations)
Puzzle.WrongAnswer: All types are checked at runtime only

Puzzle.Question: Which of these numbers is prime?
In a probability space, the sum of probabilities of all mutually exclusive outcomes of a single experiment is always equal to what?
For a continuous function f(x), which condition is sufficient for f(x) to have at least one root between a and b?
Puzzle.CorrectAnswer: f(a) and f(b) have opposite signs
Puzzle.WrongAnswer: f(a) and f(b) are both positive

Puzzle.Question: In many languages, what is the main difference between pass-by-value and pass-by-reference?
Puzzle.CorrectAnswer: Pass-by-reference can modify the original variable

Puzzle.Question: Which of these is a characteristic of a pure function in functional programming?
Puzzle.CorrectAnswer: No side effects and same output for same input

Puzzle.Question: In Big-O notation, which of these growth rates is the fastest for large n?
You compute the greatest common divisor of two numbers using the Euclidean algorithm. What is its typical time complexity in terms of number magnitude?
Which of these is an example of an undecidable problem (in the sense of Turing)?
Puzzle.WrongAnswer: Checking if a number is prime

Puzzle.Question: You have a language L for which there exists a Turing machine that halts and accepts exactly the strings in L, but may loop forever on strings not in L. What is L called?
Which of these statements about P vs NP is currently known to be true?
Puzzle.CorrectAnswer: It is an open problem whether P = NP
Puzzle.WrongAnswer: P = NP has been proven true
P = NP has been proven false

Puzzle.Question: In a finite-state machine, which of these is true?
Puzzle.CorrectAnswer: It has a finite number of states
Puzzle.WrongAnswer: It can recognize all context-free languages

Puzzle.Question: Which of these languages is regular?
Puzzle.CorrectAnswer: The set of all strings over {0,1} with an even number of 1s

Puzzle.Question: If log₂(n) = 10, what is n?
In many languages, what is memoization?
Puzzle.CorrectAnswer: Caching function results to avoid recomputation
